aiAnalysis.summary: AFJ Limited's staging environment demonstrates strong authentication controls with all admin endpoints properly protected (403 responses), and SSL/TLS is correctly implemented. However, the application has significant security gaps in HTTP response headers across multiple pages. Four pages are missing critical security headers including X-Content-Type-Options and X-Frame-Options, which are essential for preventing MIME-sniffing attacks and clickjacking vulnerabilities. Additionally, recommended security headers like Strict-Transport-Security, Content-Security-Policy, and Permissions-Policy are absent across the entire application, leaving the platform vulnerable to various client-side attacks.
recommendations: Immediately implement X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff header on all pages to prevent MIME-type sniffing attacks
Add X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN (or DENY if not using iframes) to all pages to prevent clickjacking, currently only implemented on /admin
Deploy Strict-Transport-Security header with appropriate max-age value (minimum 31536000) to enforce HTTPS and prevent downgrade attacks
Implement Content-Security-Policy header with a restrictive policy tailored to the application's needs to mitigate XSS vulnerabilities
Add Referrer-Policy header (recommend 'strict-origin-when-cross-origin') to protect user privacy and prevent sensitive data leakage
Configure Permissions-Policy to restrict access to browser features and APIs that the application doesn't require
Apply these headers globally via web server configuration (nginx/Apache) or application framework middleware to ensure consistency across all endpoints
Conduct a security audit of the application's input validation and output encoding practices given the high number of missing CSP headers
